required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Evaluate the Safety and Activity of BB3 to Treat Heart Attack
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 2 Pilot Study to Evaluate the Safety and Activity of BB3 as an Adjunct to Percutaneous Coronary Intervention (PCI) in Subjects Presenting With Acute ST Segment Elevation Myocardial Infarction (STEMI)

collaborator.agency: National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute (NHLBI)

brief_summary.textblock: The study will evaluate the effect of BB3 to preserve myocardial (heart) tissue and function following myocardial infarction (heart attack).

detailed_description.textblock: Percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI) has become the mainstay for treatment of ST-segment elevation myocardial infarction (STEMI). Whereas early recanalization undoubtedly salvages myocardial tissue, reperfusion following prolonged ischemia can also exacerbate injury. Infarct size needs to be limited, and the conditions favoring adaptive ventricular healing and remodeling optimized because in patients with acute myocardial infarction (AMI) who do not die of out-of-hospital arrhythmias, long-term prognosis is dependent on the amount of myocardium that is lost, and the outcome of ventricular remodeling. Angion Biomedical Corp. has identified BB3, a small molecule mimetic of hepatocyte growth factor/scatter factor (HGF/SF) whose activity is expected to preserve tissue viability and attenuate dysfunction in the setting of organ injury while obviating the logistical difficulties associated with gene or protein therapy. HGF/SF is a naturally occurring cell survival factor that holds significant therapeutic potential. BB3 has been shown to possess HGF/SF activities, including protection against heart injury following myocardial infarction. This study is designed to evaluate clinical efficacy of BB3 in patients presenting with acute ST segment elevation myocardial infarction (A-STEMI) who undergo PCI.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of Reduction in Infarct Size
primary_outcome.description: Evaluation of reduction in infarct size by MRI between the BB3 and placebo treatment groups at 6 months based on index of myocardial salvage

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of the Degree of Late Ventricular Remodeling
primary_outcome.description: Evaluation of the degree of late ventricular remodeling between the BB3 and placebo treatment groups at 6 months, as measured by increase in LV end-diastolic volume index (LVEDVI) from initial MR image (day 5±1) to late MR image (6 months).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Symptoms and Clinical Signs of CHF
Change in LVEDVI, LVESVI and LV Ejection Fraction (EF) After MI Assessed by Cine MR (SSFP Imaging)
LVEDVI, LVESVI and LVEF After MI Assessed by 2D and 3D Echocardiography
Change Between Initial Semi-quantitative Regional Wall Motion Score (17 Segment Model) by Echocardiography
Change in Regional Myocardial Radial, Circumferential and Longitudinal Strain
Frequency of New Onset CHF Through 6 Months
Number of Hospitalizations for CHF Through 6 Months
Incidence of Complete ST Segment Resolution 60 ± 30 Minutes After Last Angiogram
Development of Ventricular Fibrillation or Other Life-threatening Arrhythmia
Symptoms and Clinical Signs of CHF
secondary_outcome.description: Symptoms and clinical signs of CHF measured by NYHA classification

arm_group.description: Daily intravenous administration of 2 mg/kg BB3 for four (4) days
Daily intravenous administration for four (4) days

intervention.description: Daily intravenous administration of 2 mg/kg BB3 for four (4) days
Daily intravenous administration for four (4) days. The volume of normal saline will vary by estimated weight.

clinical_study.keyword: Acute ST Segment Elevation Myocardial Infarction (STEMI)

group.title: BB3, 4 Daily Doses
group.description: BB3: Daily intravenous administration of 2 mg/kg BB3 for four (4) days ; 10 to 12 minutes; small molecule mimetic of hepatocyte growth factor

group.title: Placebo; 4 Daily Doses
group.description: Placebo: Normal saline; Daily intravenous administration for four (4) days. The volume of normal saline will vary by estimated weight.

group.title: BB3, 4 Daily Doses
group.description: BB3: Daily intravenous administration of 2 mg/kg BB3 for four (4) days

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Normal saline. Daily intravenous administration for four (4) days.

outcome.title: Evaluation of Reduction in Infarct Size
outcome.description: Evaluation of reduction in infarct size by MRI between the BB3 and placebo treatment groups at 6 months based on index of myocardial salvage
outcome.population: Five subjects were enrolled into the study; 3 subjects were randomized to BB3 and 2 subjects to placebo. Of the 3 subjects randomized to BB3, 1 completed study treatment; all three subjects discontinued the study prematurely. The two subjects randomized to placebo completed study treatment and neither discontinued the study prematurely.

group.title: BB3, 4 Daily Doses
group.description: BB3: Daily intravenous administration of 2 mg/kg BB3 for four (4) days

group.title: Placebo, 4 Daily Doses
group.description: Normal saline. Daily intravenous administration for four (4) days.

measure.description: Evaluation of reduction in infarct size by MRI between the BB3 and placebo treatment groups at 6 months based on index of myocardial salvage
measure.population: Five subjects were enrolled into the study; 3 subjects were randomized to BB3 and 2 subjects to placebo. Of the 3 subjects randomized to BB3, 1 completed study treatment; all three subjects discontinued the study prematurely. The two subjects randomized to placebo completed study treatment and neither discontinued the study prematurely.

outcome.title: Evaluation of the Degree of Late Ventricular Remodeling
outcome.description: Evaluation of the degree of late ventricular remodeling between the BB3 and placebo treatment groups at 6 months, as measured by increase in LV end-diastolic volume index (LVEDVI) from initial MR image (day 5±1) to late MR image (6 months).

group.title: BB3 Small Molecule Mimetic of Hepatocyte Growth Factor
group.description: small molecule mimetic of hepatocyte growth factor/scatter factor BB3: Daily intravenous administration of 2 mg/kg BB3 for four (4) days

group.description: Normal saline Placebo: Daily intravenous administration for four (4) days. The volume of normal saline will vary by estimated weight.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Five subjects were enrolled into the study; 3 subjects were randomized to BB3 and 2 subjects to placebo. All the 3 subjects randomized to BB3 discontinued the study prematurely. The 2 subjects randomized to placebo completed study treatment.
